content: simple summer socks by liz pankratz these lacy socks were designed to be made from a single 50-gram skein of koigu kpppm i wanted the yarn s stun- ning colours to still be displayed without being overshadowed by a stitch pattern or vice versa and so these lovely little socks came about they feature toe-up construction a short-row heel and a very simple lace pattern to flaunt your yarn s gorgeous colour what you ll need before you begin 1 50-gram skein of koigu kpppm or other sock yarn divide your yarn into two 25-gram balls 2 5mm needles either double-points or circulars this way you can be sure you won t and whatever size you need to get gauge accidentally use more than half on one 2 stitch markers sock 1 tapestry needle gauge 28 sts over 4 inches in stockinette st toe using a figure 8 cast-on or your preferred toe-up cast-on method co 20 sts 10 on each of 2 needles if using dpns divide evenly onto four needles round 1 pm either on your needle between sts or if beginning of round falls between needles on the fabric k1 m1l k8 m1r k1 twice round 2 k all sts round 3 k1 m1l k to 1 st before next m m1r k1 twice round 4 k all sts repeat last 2 rnds 4 more times 44 sts next round k1 m1l k to next m k1 m1l k to 1 st before next m m1r k1 the needle s with a total of 23 sts will become the patterned instep while increases continue on the bottom of the foot foot set-up round
